intro: Plantago media subsp. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf plantain, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense spikes, which are borne on slender stalks. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers moist, well-drained environments. This species is often used in traditional medicine and as a ground cover in landscaping.
